subject: ENISA Article 14 Requests
document(english): ENISA Article 14 Requests  www.enisa.europa.eu  European Union Agency For Network And Information Security  ENISA Article 14 Requests  Report on 2018 requests  FINAL  DECEMBER 2018  http://www.enisa.europa.eu/  ENISA Article 14 Requests  Final  | December 2018  02  About ENISA  The European Union Agency for Network and Information Security (ENISA) is a centre of network and  information security expertise for the EU, its member states, the private sector and Europe’s citizens.  ENISA works with these groups to develop advice and recommendations on good practice in information  security. It assists EU member states in implementing relevant EU legislation and works to improve the  resilience of Europe’s critical information infrastructure and networks. ENISA seeks to enhance existing  expertise in EU member states by supporting the development of cross-border communities committed to  improving network and information security throughout the EU. More information about ENISA and its  work can be found at www.enisa.europa.eu.  Contact  For contacting the authors or for media enquiries about this paper, please use press@enisa.europa.eu.  Legal notice  Notice must be taken that this publication represents the views and interpretations of the authors and  editors, unless stated otherwise. This publication should not be construed to be a legal action of ENISA or  the ENISA bodies unless adopted pursuant to the Regulation (EU) No 526/2013. This publication does not  necessarily represent state-of the-art and ENISA may update it from time to time.  Third-party sources are quoted as appropriate. ENISA is not responsible for the content of the external  sources including external websites referenced in this publication.  This publication is intended for information purposes only. It must be accessible free of charge. Neither  ENISA nor any person acting on its behalf is responsible for the use that might be made of the  information contained in this publication. ENISA Article 14 Requests  Final  | December 2018  03  Table of Contents  ENISA Article 14 Requests 4  Introduction 4  Overview of Article 14 requests in 2017-2018 4  Table of requests 4  ENISA Article 14 Requests  Final  | December 2018  04  ENISA Article 14 Requests  Introduction  This concise report provides an overview of the requests to the Agency according to article 14 of  Regulation (EU) No 526/2013. Information contained in this report is accurate as on 03 December 2018.  Overview of Article 14 requests in 2017-2018  Key figures in this report are the following:  2017 2018 % Change  Number of new requests: 20 17 -15%  Number of requests in progress: 3 12 +300%  Number of requests completed: 19 5 -74%  Number of requests received 2018 to be initiated 2019  0  Effort in person days:  281,2 701 +149%  Effort in Euros (FTE(1) including overhead) (2)  €157.209,92 €405.178 +157%  Direct Cost(3): €117.901,37 €33.348 -72%  Total Cost:  €275.111,29 €438.667 +59%  (1) Mean full time equivalent (FTE) costs are calculated on the basis of the total budget consumption over 201,6 actual working days p.a., to support salaries and overhead for staff in  service in the reference year (65,28 FTEs in 2018 including TA, CA and SNE).  (2) Based on statistical analysis at the end of 2018 the use Cost of a person-day in 2018 (including overheads) is €578.  (3) Mission costs, other direct expenses linked to request are included in this budget estimate.  The effort in person days was provided by staff from the Core Operations Department – there were no  additional staff costs incurred. Direct costs were provided out of the operational part of the budget (Title 3  appropriations).  Table of requests  The table of requests outlines all current ongoing requests per country. The budget indicated is the direct  budget concerning mission costs and other direct expenses. DG GROW  Support DG GROW for IT  Security requirements of  Medical Devices Regulations  5PDs €2890 €1800 In progress  9  European  Commission  EC - DG SANTE  Support in the activities of  the 3rd Joint Action on  eHealth  2PDs €1156 €0 In progress  10  EU  Institution  EEAS  Cyber Education Training  Exercise and Evaluation  (ETEE) Platform  €0 In progress  11  EU  Institution  EU-LISA  Request to support eu-LISA  exercise (it also includes  training)  502.5PDs* €290,445 €10000 In progress  ENISA Article 14 Requests  Final  | December 2018  06  Origin Institution Title Effort in  person days  Effort in € Budget Status  12 Poland NASK  Consultation in the area of  cybersecurity certification in  EU  5PDs €2890 €1734,49 Complete  13 Estonia Ria  Cooperation Group work on  cross-border dependencies  7PDs €4046 €2000  Complete  14 Bulgaria Bulgarian Presidency  Request for assistance on  Cybersecurity Taxonomy  50PDs €28900 0€ Complete  15 Poland  Ministry of Digital  Affairs  Request NISD  Implementation  0,5PDs €289 0€ Complete  16 Greece  National Cyber Security  Authority of Greece  Request on Industrial  systems security initiatives  0,5PDs €289 0€ In Progress  17  EU  Institution  ECB  Request EUROSystem red  team testing framework  10PDs €5780 364,93€ Complete  *The Agency was compensated for the 402 person days for this project.
